requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: GET shard-topology-operational

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: RPC add-replicas-for-all-shards
requests.description: Adds replicas on this node for all currently defined shards. This is equivalent to issuing an add-shard-replica RPC for all shards.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: Fetch Shared details-Topology
requests.description:
Fetch clustering related data and look for following details to make sure that cluster is up and running.
User should direct this request to the controller where jolokia agent is installed.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: Fetch Cluster details
requests.description:
Fetch clustering related data and look for following details to make sure that cluster is up and running.
Members field should list all the cluster nodes added to the cluster.
Also the Unreachable fields should be empty.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: Fetch Shared details-Inventory
requests.description:
Fetch clustering related data and look for following details to make sure that cluster is up and running.
User should direct this request to the controller where jolokia agent is installed.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: GET entity-ownership-operational

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: RPC backup-datastore
requests.description:
Creates a backup file of the datastore state.

To restore the backup on the target node the file needs to be placed into the $KARAF_HOME/clustered-datastore-restore directory, and then the node restarted. If the directory does not exist (which is quite likely if this is a first-time restore) it needs to be created. On startup, ODL checks if the journal and snapshots directories in $KARAF_HOME are empty, and only then tries to read the contents of the clustered-datastore-restore directory, if it exists. So for a successful restore, those two directories should be empty. The backup file name itself does not matter, and the startup process will delete it after a successful restore.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: List schemas

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: RPC remove-shard-replica
requests.description: Removes an existing replica of a shard from this node via the RemoveServer mechanism as described in the Raft paper.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: List schemas

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: RPC remove-all-shard-replicas
requests.description: Removes replicas for all shards on this node. This is equivalent to issuing a remove-shard-replica for all shards and essentially removes this node from a cluster.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: RPC flip-member-voting-states-for-all-shards
requests.description: Flips the voting states of all cluster members for all shards, such that if a member was voting it becomes non-voting and vice versa.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: Fetch Shared details-Inventory
requests.description:
Fetch clustering related data and look for following details to make sure that cluster is up and running.
User should direct this request to the controller where jolokia agent is installed.

requests.headers:
Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
requests.name: RPC change-member-voting-states-for-all-shards
requests.description: Changes the voting states, either voting or non-voting, of cluster members for all shards. Non-voting members will no longer participate in leader elections and consensus but will be replicated. This is useful for having a set of members serve as a backup cluster in case the primary voting cluster suffers catastrophic failure. This RPC can be issued to any cluster member and will be forwarded to the leader.
